授業目的: This course is an introduction to various issues related to contemporary Japanese society, where we consider “contemporary Japan” as a “post-war Japan.” The course is designed to discuss demographic/structural patterns of Japanese society, such as class, gender, ethnic stratification, as well as analyzes various special topics that explain Japanese society, such as working conditions, education, family, etc. Overall the course will provide you with tools for understanding Japan’s positioning in the World, help you in re-examining stereotypical ideas about Japan and understand better the culture and its people.
到達目標:
•Demonstrate a basic understanding of different interpretations of Japanese culture and society;
•Understand various social problems in Japan;
•Understand the relationship between the demographic/structural patterns and social happenings;
•Assess the impact of globalization on everyday life in Japan;
•Demonstrate the ability to work independently and in a self-directed manner through appropriate planning, time management, and completion of course work;
•Demonstrate an ability to make a positive contribution to small group discussion and activities;
•With a degree of confidence, begin to critically engage with source material in order to accurately summarize key themes/topics in a presentation format;
•Synthesize a small number of readings to produce summary reports.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.

【合併】総合日本学習科目（社会）（CIEC）/Japanese Society（国際学部）
授業方法: Since I believe that sociological thinking can be developed through practice, the classes will be organized in an interactional way, where you should feel free to criticize, justify, and solve the issues we discuss. To achieve the abovementioned goals, I will select a variety of readings, films, presentation topics, and assignments.
